CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 18, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "ENGAGES SUPPORT - Confronted... neighbors who demanded a traffic... Webster Avenue and Morgan Street... Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, also... promised that he would help them. A child was killed at the intersection Thursday.  This citizens were rallied to demand action by Curtis Williams, (patch on face) of the Nineteenth District.  With a meaningful gesture of his left hand, Mr. Williams pledged action. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group, including Robert "Pappy" Williams near center, and Curtis Williams wearing bandage on cheek, standing in Webster Avenue, protesting lack of stop signs, police patrol, and lights
